result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert W Sexton Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Robert W Sexton Jr

parties.name: Washington County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes: lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not associate with any known drug users or dealers or be in any place where illegal drugs are purchased, sold or consumed.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment, schooling or both.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt: Disposition Form

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: CP.  Statements from State and counsel.  Agreement reached. Uncharged offense of Theft from January, 2017 dismissed and read-in.  Def agrees to be bound by plea entered 5-25-16, and confirms plea as being guilty.  Court previously found def guilty based upon that plea.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Hearing on November 14, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Katherine Romanowich.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def has pending Br 1 case (15CF240).  Counsel req adj for global resolution w/no PSI being requested as def now wishes to accept probation.  Counsel shall review the previously filed plea questionnaire with defendant prior to next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Hearing on November 8, 2017 at 01:15 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Daniel Ervin Larsen.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (15CF240 Br. 1)  Defendant missed court  due to being in a car accident and the defendant has now been assisting in ongoing investigations in Milwaukee Co.  State request $1,000.00 cash bond.  Atty. Larsen request lower cash bond.  Court orders $1,000.00 cash bond.  Defendant makes statements that he wishes to finish the case and had turned himself in and cannot afford the cash bond and promises will return to court.  Court maintains the cash bond as ordered.  Hearing scheduled for November 8, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
